txt.en:
'Good work, so far. Get your hands to work and forge that <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze helm</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Metalsmithy tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Metalsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>

'Grab your <rgb=#FF00FF00>smith's hammer</rgb> and make sure you have it equipped, then <rgb=#FF00FF00>open the crate</rgb> of ingredients that I gave you and make your way to the forge.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Metalsmiths are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospector profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'It looks as though you have strayed a little ways from home, [placeholder], and you want to learn the art of working metal?

'It seems, then, that you have come to the right place.

'You want to speak with Gestur by the forge. He will be able to set you upon the path of metalsmithing.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'Metalsmithy, is it? A fine choice for any self-respecting dwarf!

'We make the finest armour and shields in all the world, of that there is no doubt. Go over to the forge and speak with Gestur.

'He will set you on the path to becoming another in a long litany of fine metalsmiths.'

'You are far from home, [placeholder]. We will honour your request and help you as you learn the art of metalsmithy.

'Anorthint, near the forge, is an apprentice in the art of metalsmithing. If you are looking for guidance, I am certain that he will be willing to assist you with the fundamentals of the craft.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'Working with metal allows us to create fine tools and intricately-detailed armour. It is a noble pursuit that can bring great solace to those who are wholly given to the endeavour.

'I have asked one of our promising novices to watch over and guide any new metalsmiths towards learning the very basics of the profession. His name is Anorthint, and he stands near the forge here at the Terrace.

'Speak with him, and he will teach you the very basics as he progresses in his own studies.'

'You will find Cotman Brown near the forge here in the Crafting Area. 

'He is knowledgeable in the art of metalsmithy and is awaiting the arrival of new would-be metalsmiths. 

'Speak with him if you are interested in learning and practicing the metalsmithy profession.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>
You have made a bronze chain link

'I think that crafting metal is a very noble pursuit, and I have enlisted the aid of one of the finest novices in Michel Delving to assist each new apprentice.\n\n'You will want to speak with Cotman Brown over near the forge. He has volunteered his time and energy to teach all the new apprentices. Mind him well.'
You have made a bronze helm

'Well, look at you. I do not often see your folk here, and when I do, I always find it a bit queer. Well, hobbits less so because of the hill.

'Oh, I am sorry, you wish to know more of metalsmithy? It just so happens that there is a fine metalsmith in this very hall, still learning, but taking to the art very quickly. His name is Bill Digweed, and you will find him by the forge in the larger room.

'Good day, [placeholder].'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'Metalsmithy is a goal worth pursuing, and there are many fine metalsmiths here in Combe.'

She smiles.

'I have secured the time and teaching of Bill Digweed, a novice metalsmith, but a fine student who is quickly refining his art, to teach all those who are looking to set out as metalsmiths.

'He can be found near the forge, here in the Craft Hall of Combe.'

'Hullo, there. I hear that you are interested in learning the ways of a metalsmith. If so, you have come to the right place.

'I will try to not move too quickly for you, but if I do, speak with me again to ask more pointed questions.

'I almost forgot the most important thing for every new metalsmith -- ingredients. Everything you need to make a bronze helm is inside this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Metalsmith vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Metalsmith's training and continued work.</rgb>

Metalsmiths provide armour and tools to the peoples of Middle-earth. Becoming a metalsmith can be difficult, but the wares that they provide are a necessity throughout the world.

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Be careful! You will need to complete the correct recipes and deliver the correct items outlined in this quest. 

You will need to execute the bronze helm recipe and deliver the bronze helm. Failing to do so will force you to obtain new raw materials or to restart the quest after a 24-hour delay.</rgb>
Speak with the Novice Metalsmith near the forge in the crafting area
You have been provided with ingredients
Open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> given to you by the Novice Metalsmith to collect the two bronze ingots
You now have all the ingredients to make a bronze helm
Using the ingredients you received, craft a <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze chain link</rgb>
Using the ingredients you have, forge a <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze helm</rgb>
Bring the <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze helm</rgb> to the Novice Metalsmith
'Do you have the bronze helm on you? I do not see it. I hope you did not turn it into slag or sell it for coin. I would like to inspect that work. You had best find a way to make another.'
You should speak with the Novice Metalsmith to learn more about metalsmithy.

The Novice Metalsmith provided you with a <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> full of ingredients that you can use to execute the bronze helm recipe. Open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> to get the ingredients.\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Metalsmiths are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospector profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

#-1:[placeholder]#-1:{Cotman[O]|Anorthint[L]|Gestur[D]|Bill} provided you with the ingredients necessary to create a bronze helm. First, however, you must prepare the <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze chain link</rgb>.
Create the <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze helm</rgb>, as instructed by the Novice Metalsmith.
The recipe is complete. <rgb=#FF00FF00>Do not sell the bronze helm!</rgb> It is time to show your handiwork to your mentor, the Novice Metalsmith.

'If you are looking for guidance in metalsmithy, then I am prepared to offer you direction.

'If my methods are too fast, feel free to speak with me again, and I will answer any questions that you may have. I will do my best to provide you with clear direction. The first and most important step is having the proper ingredients.

'I have kept some of these ingredients aside for the purpose of providing to new metalsmiths. Take this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> and let us begin.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Metlasmith vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Metalsmith's training and continued work.</rgb>
'You should speak at once with the metalsmith trainer.'

'Well, look here... another would-be metalsmith. I am pleased to meet you and looking forward to helping you get started.

'If I go too fast or you need help at any point, you can ask me questions about metalsmithy, and I will do my best to provide you with clear direction. The first and most important step is having the proper ingredients.

'I set aside a few for new metalsmiths like yourself. Take this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> and let us begin.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Metalsmith vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Metalsmith's training and continued work.</rgb>
'You should speak at once with the metalsmith trainer.'

'Hello, there. I hear that you are interested in learning the ways of a metalsmith. If so, you have come to the right place.

'I will try to not move too quickly for you, but if I do, speak with me again to ask more pointed questions.

'I almost forgot the most important thing for every new metalsmith -- ingredients. Everything you need to make a bronze helm is inside this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Metalsmith vendors sell ingredients and recipes that are a vital part of any Metalsmith's training and continued work.</rgb>
'You should speak at once with the metalsmith trainer.'

'Let me see what you were able to do...'

He inspects the helmet with a discerning eye.

'Feels to be about the right weight and is shaped well. No flaws that I can see. 

'I think that you have done very, very well, [placeholder]. I approve and declare you a novice metalsmith.'
'You should speak at once with the metalsmith trainer.'
'Oh no, did you sell your bronze helm? Well, I need to inspect one, so you had better find a way to make me another.'

'Take your smith's hammer to the forge and hammer out that <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze chain link</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Metalsmith tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Metalsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>

'Let us see what you have gone and made.'

He inhales deeply and brings the helmet to eye level.

'A nice even pound to the metal, there are no thin spots to speak of, and the shape is nearly perfect.

'You pass, [placeholder]. You are on your way towards becoming a master metalsmith!'

'Good work, so far. Get your hands to work and craft that <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze helm</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Metalsmithy tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Metalsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>
'I hope you did not turn the helm to slag. Or did you sell it for some meagre coin? Well...I cannot pass you without seeing your handiwork. Back to the forge with you!'

'Grab your <rgb=#FF00FF00>smith's hammer</rgb> and make sure you have it equipped, then open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I gave you and make your way to the forge.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Metalsmithss are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospector profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'You will first need to make the <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze chain link</rgb>. Go to the forge and craft the <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze chain link</rgb>. This will provide you the key ingredients for the bronze helm.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Metalsmith tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Metalsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>

'May I see the helm?'

He takes a moment to admire your handiwork.

'This appears to be a well-crafted piece of armour. You are well on your way towards becoming a metalsmith. Well done, [placeholder].'

'You need to make the <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze helm</rgb> and return it to me for approval.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Metalsmithy tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember:Iin order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Metalsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>

'Making the <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze chain link</rgb> will be easy. Shape the metal over by the forge with your smith's hammer. Little else needed to do beyond that.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Metalsmith tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Metalsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>
'Have you forgotten something? I do not see the bronze helm that you were supposed to deliver to me. You should return with one.'
Introduction to Metalsmithy

'To make the bronze helm, you will need to open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I provided to you. Equip your <rgb=#FF00FF00>smith's hammer</rgb>, then head to the forge and begin metalsmithing.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Metalsmiths are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospector profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'Go on now and make that <rgb=#FF00FF00>bronze helm</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Metalsmithy tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Metalsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>

'Let me see what you have done.'

He examines the helm closely.

'This is good work. There are no thin spots in the metal, and it appears to be shaped accordingly.

'I think that this is a very good effort and proves that you are prepared to continue your work towards becoming a master metalsmith.'

'Just open up that <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> full of ingredients that I gave you, and you can start making the bronze helm over by the forge. Make sure to equip your <rgb=#FF00FF00>smith's hammer!</rgb>'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for Metalsmiths are normally purchased from vendors or traded from players with the prospector profession. You can also find ingredients on the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'Making the bronze helm is simple. Work the metal over forge by heating and cooling it, while hammering it into the shape of a helm.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Metalsmith tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: In order to execute a recipe, you must be near the proper facility. Metalsmithy requires a forge.</rgb>
